node.title: Lajamanu on edge after first confirmed COVID case, but vaccination rates have suddenly 'really shifted'
node.description: Vaccination rates in Lajamanu surge as NT health authorities race to track down the movements of the remote community's first local COVID case.
node.content:
["Vaccination rates in Lajamanu\u00a0have surged as NT health authorities race to track\u00a0down\u00a0the movements of the remote community's first\u00a0local COVID case.", "The positive case, announced on Thursday,\u00a0is\u00a0a fully vaccinated Lajamanu man, 45, bringing\u00a0the total number of\u00a0cases linked to the Katherine outbreak\u00a0to\u00a060.", "Lockdown orders were lifted in Lajamanu on Wednesday.", "The remote community, located about 560 kilometres south-west of Katherine, is\u00a0now operating under a lockout.\u00a0", "Sinon Cooney,\u00a0chief executive of Katherine West Health Board, said locals were \"really worried about COVID being in Lajamanu\".\u00a0", "\"We're still trying to understand where this case has been, and we're working closely with NT government and CDC (Centre for Disease Control)\u00a0around the case and their close contacts out in Laj,\" he said.", "However, he said it was some\u00a0relief to know the positive case\u00a0had a low viral load, and that nearby wastewater had recently returned negative COVID results.\u00a0", "About 40 per cent of the Lajamanu community is\u00a0currently double-vaccinated, he said, but that rate is set to dramatically improve in coming weeks.\u00a0", "\"The outbreak in Katherine has really shifted the sentiment around vaccinations in Lajamanu,\" he said, adding\u00a0about 90 per cent of current residents had now received their first dose.", "\"If everything progresses in the same direction it has been \u2014\u00a0I should think in the next two to four weeks \u2014\u00a0we should be getting very close to that 80 per cent double-dose [target].\"", "
Binjari restrictions eased slightly
", "The small community of Binjari, near Katherine, has now\u00a0moved from a hard lockdown to a standard lockdown after wastewater samples and 147 COVID-19 tests came back negative.", "Acting Chief Health Officer Charles Pain said despite encouraging signs,\u00a0it was too risky to move the community into a lockout like Katherine due to the risk of transmission in large households.", "Binjari resident Peggy Slater, who was taken to Howard Springs quarantine facility after being identified as a close contact, said the past few weeks had\u00a0been \"a bit hectic, and a bit stressful\".\u00a0", "\"Far out, you think with COVID, you just think, 'Who's got it?' and things like that when you're walking around,\" she said.\u00a0", "The first-dose vaccination rate in Binjari is now at 100 per cent, according to NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner.\u00a0", "But Ms Slater said most of the community was \"not happy with all the stories they've been hearing\" from people outside Binjari who have been\u00a0spreading vaccine\u00a0misinformation.", "\"The main thing is to listen to the Indigenous people that have had the needles, and explaining that, you know, it's not dangerous,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"It could save your life, basically.\"", "
Katherine testing continues
", "NT health authorities in Katherine are working to find out why wastewater samples taken from\u00a0the Bicentennial Road catchment in Katherine East continue to test positive to COVID-19.\u00a0\u00a0", "At a COVID press conference on Thursday, Health Minister Natasha Fyles said it was possible several close contacts in Katherine had developed the coronavirus, which may explain the positive wastewater results.", "Dr Pain urged residents to get tested for COVID, saying \"testing rates have not been up to the levels that I would hope\".\u00a0"]
